modules.name: MolDraw
modules.comments:
A lightweight, 3D molecular viewer.

For usage examples, see: https://github.com/lukasturcani/molDraw

declarations.comments:
Create `GeometryData` from explicit atoms and bonds.

The reason this returns an `Either`, is that the provided bonds
maybe be invalid. For example, if you have 3 atoms, but
also a bond, which says its connected to an atom with id 50.
This is clearly invalid input.

modules.name: MolDraw.Atom
modules.comments:
Defines the `Atom` type.

You will probably wonder why there is both an `Atom` and a
`GeometryAtom` type. `Atom` represents atoms individually, while
`GeometryAtom` represents an atom in the context of a molecule.
Essentially, the difference is simply that `GeometryAtom` has an
id, while an `Atom` does not.

declarations.comments: Represents atoms.
declarations.title: Atom

declarations.comments: Get the position of an atom.
declarations.title: position

declarations.comments: Get the chemical symbol of an atom.
declarations.title: chemicalSymbol

declarations.comments: Create an atom.
declarations.title: atom

declarations.comments: Represents a bond.
declarations.title: Bond

declarations.comments: Get the id of the first atom.
declarations.title: atom1Id

declarations.comments: Get the id of the second atom.
declarations.title: atom2Id

declarations.comments: Get the bond order.
declarations.title: order

declarations.comments: Create a bond.
declarations.title: bond

modules.name: MolDraw.BondSegment
modules.comments:
Defines and deals with bond segments.

To draw a bond, it must be divided into segments. A bond
segment is always one color. A single bond will have two bond
segments, because the color of each half of the bond must match
the color of the atom it is connected to. A double bond will have
4 bond segments. This because you need two sticks to represent a
double bond, and those sticks need to be split in half so that
each half can have a different color. Triple bonds have 6 bond
segments and so on.

declarations.comments: Represents a segment of a bond, of a single color.
declarations.title: BondSegment

declarations.comments: Get the atom to which the segment is attached.
declarations.title: atom

declarations.comments: Get the position of a `BondSegment`.
declarations.title: position

declarations.comments: Create bond segments from a bond between two atoms.
declarations.title: bondSegments

declarations.comments: Get the gap between the `BondSegment` and the bond center.
declarations.title: gapSize

declarations.comments: Get the length of the segment.
declarations.title: length

declarations.comments: Get the width of the segment.
declarations.title: width

declarations.comments: Draw a scene in a HTML container.
declarations.title: drawMol

declarations.comments: Represents a three.js mesh.
declarations.title: Mesh

declarations.comments:
Holds user-provided options for customizing the drawn mesh.

* `atomSize`: Takes a `GeometryAtom` and returns the size it
should be drawn with.
* `atomColor`: Takes a `GeometryAtom` and returns the color
it should be drawn with.
* `atomScale`: A scaling factor applied to the sizes of all atoms.
* `atomWidthSegments`: The number of width segments used to
draw each atom. More segments make the the atoms look rounder,
but are more expensive to draw.
* `atomHeightSegments`: The number of height segments used to draw
each atom. More segments make the atoms look rounder, but are
more expensive to draw.
`bondRadialSegments`: The number of radial segments used to draw
bonds.
`bondHeightSegments`: The number of height segments used to draw
bonds.
`material`: Takes a color, and returns the material used for
drawing atoms and bonds.
declarations.title: MeshOptions

declarations.comments: Represents three.js materials.
declarations.title: Material

declarations.comments: Create the meshes which compose a molecule.
declarations.title: meshes

declarations.comments: Represents a three.js scene.
declarations.title: Scene

declarations.comments:
Holds user-provided options for customizing the drawn scene.

* `backgroundColor`: The color of the scene background.
* `containerId`: The id of the HTML div in which the scene should
be drawn.
* `outline`: Toggles the drawing of an outline around the drawn
atoms and bonds.
declarations.title: SceneOptions

declarations.comments: Create a three.js scene.
declarations.title: scene

modules.name: MolDraw.GeometryAtom
modules.comments:
Defines the `GeometryAtom` type.

A `GeometryAtom` is an atom in the context of a molecule, meaning
that unlike `Atom`, it has an id.

declarations.comments: Represents atoms in molecules.
declarations.title: GeometryAtom

declarations.title: atom

declarations.comments: Create a `GeometryAtom` from an `Atom`.
declarations.title: fromAtom
